Name: α Cen A
Notes:
Rigel Kent, Toliman; nearest star system; 4th brightest star; a component 
of the triple Alpha Centauri star system

Name: β Cen
Notes: Hadar, Agena; β Cep variable, Δ*V* = 0.045m, *P* = 0.157 d

Name: α Cen B
Notes:
21st brightest star; a component of the triple Alpha Centauri star system; 
has a planet (b)

Name: ν Cen
Notes: rotating ellipsoidal variable and β Cep variable, Δ*V* = 0.03m

Name: 3 Cen A
Notes: V983 Cen; double star; possible eclipsing binary, Δ*V* = 0.05m

Name: H Cen
Notes: V945 Cen; long-period pulsating variable, Δ*V* = 0.02m

Name: Przybylski's Star
Notes:
V816 Cen; chemically peculiar star; δ Sct variable, *V*max = 7.996m, *V*min 
= 8.020m, *P* = 0.0084306 d

Name: Proxima Centauri
Notes:
α Cen C, V645 Cen; nearest star; flare star; a component of the triple 
Alpha Centauri star system

Name: Krzeminski's Star
Notes:
V779 Cen; optical component of X-ray binary star Centaurus X-3; eclipsing 
binary, *V*max = 13.25m, *V*min = 13.46m, *P* = 2.08726 d

Name: BPM 37093
Notes: V886 Cen; nicknamed Lucy;[2] white dwarf; ZZ Cet variable, Δ*V* = 0.02m

Name: 2M1207
Notes: 2MASSW J1207334-393254; brown dwarf; has a planet 2M1207b
